content.description:
Looks much easier than it actually turns out to be! 

  Locate the striking, left-angling finger crack.   

  There are a few ways to start this rig, but it all comes down to gaining the few moves in the finger crack, then a lock-off to a semi-bucket out left.   

  Strenuous and uncompromising, this problem is a real prize!
content.protection: Multiple pads are mandatory, as the landing is less than stellar.
content.location: Up behind the large cave/boulder behind the visitor kiosk, and past "Green Mountain Gringo".

pathTokens: Boulders Behind the Main Parking Lot/Visitor Center

content.description:
Home to a great and easy looking, but hard to climb, crack "Rhode Island Ripper. 

  The name of the boulder is for lack of a better one.  Let me know if you have another name.
